The delivery must be completed as per terms and conditions and as per delivery date. Any delay for whatever reason needs to be informed to the person issuing the PO.'In consideration of the mutual covenants vendor shall be deemed to have agreed to be bound by these terms and conditions and providing the above stated services to Knight Frank.This Purchase order constitutes the sole and entire understandings, unless a separate agreement after this P.O date has been executed and signed by the parties overriding the additional, inconsistent or conflicting provisions of this Purchase order.

Standard Terms and Condition:
  1. Subject to satisfactory verification of invoices, Knight Frank shall make payment to the Vendor against the invoices submitted by the Vendor either within a period of 60 days from the date of receipt of invoices or subject to payment receipt from the end user customer whichever is later. All payments would be made would be subject to tax deduction at source, as may be applicable under the Income Tax Act, 1961 and other applicable laws.
  2. Invoices or demands against invoices will be deemed untimely if Vendor, fails to send such invoices or demands within 20 days of rendering of the services or selling of goods whereby Knight Frank will not be liable for payment of such untimely invoices and demands unless Knight Frank at its sole discretion agrees that reasonable circumstances resulted in the billing delays, in which case, the period shall be extended by 10 days after above mentioned 20 days and such decision of Knight Frank shall be final and binding on the Vendor. Upon the expiry of the said extended period of 30 days if the invoices and demands have not been received by the appropriate Knight Frank representative, then Knight Frank shall have no liability for payment of the same and the Vendor shall have no right to collect any outstanding balances due and owing to the Vendor. The Vendor further confirms to indemnify Knight Frank for any claims made by itself or otherwise for the said delayed invoices.
  3. The Vendor shall be liable to indemnify and keep the Knight Frank fully indemnified towards all costs, charges, expenses, losses, damages including attorney's fees suffered or arising out of or in connection with any negligence, default, misconduct or dishonesty or error or omission of the Vendor and its personnel.
  4. The Vendor shall ensure full and proper compliance by it and by all personnel employed or deployed by them of all applicable laws, rules, regulations and other statutory requirements, in carrying out their duties and obligations hereunder. The employees deployed by the Vendor will never claim to be the employee of KNIGHT FRANK and all the responsibility of compliance pertaining to the applicable and prevailing labour laws will vest with the Vendor and the Vendor will always keep KNIGHT FRANK indemnified to that extent. The Vendor shall duly satisfy KNIGHT FRANK by the 15th of each month that all its aforesaid payments, obligations and liabilities towards the personnel engaged by it in respect of the previous month have been duly made and discharged, failing which, KNIGHT FRANK will have the right, to withhold or deduct the concerned amount from, or out of, the payment due from it to the Vendor.
  5. Salaries/Wages must be paid by the Vendor to their employees as per the Minimum Wages Act and any labour legislation as applicable from time to time.
  6. Proof of payments to Government Treasury in respect of PF, ESIC, will be made available to KNIGHT FRANK. A copy of the challans and the relevant salary/wage sheet, attendance sheet duly signed by the Site Manager, for the relevant month will be attached in support of bills that are submitted for payment by the Vendor to KNIGHT FRANK. KNIGHT FRANK reserves the right to withhold all payments of the Vendor if adequate evidence of complete compliance is not provided by the Vendor. The challans used for deposition of ESIC and PF to the Government treasury will be KNIGHT FRANK exclusive or in case of consolidated challans the supporting should be explanatory enough. The Vendor agrees and undertakes that all statutory dues and obligations and liabilities in respect of personnel engaged by them will be promptly paid and discharged by them. All statutory provisions relating to the engagement of such personnel will be strictly complied with by the Vendor, including but not limited to Minimum Wages Act, Payment of Bonus Act, ESIC Act, EPFMP Act, Payment of Gratuity Act etc.
  7. The Vendors agrees to obtain a licence from concerned authorities under the Contract Labour (Abolition and Regulation) Act 1970, and the rules framed thereunder and furnish a copy of the same to KNIGHT FRANK wherever and whenever applicable.
  8. The Vendor will conduct periodic training for its personnel deployed at the subject site, and provide a formal report to KNIGHT FRANK, and acknowledgement taken. Vendor shall ensure that his personnel shall maintain high standards of behaviour and do not indulge in any activity like drinking, smoking, gambling or any such activities which are legally or morally unacceptable.
  9. Background verification of all the employees of the Vendor need to be undertaken by the Vendor without fail Any legal or police case related to any employee of the Vendor will be Vendor's sole responsibility, and if in any eventuality, some monetary loss occurs to KNIGHT FRANK, the same will be compensated to KNIGHT FRANK by the Vendor.
  10. In the event of any complaint being made against any personnel by any occupant/resident of the building to the Site Manager or the Client of the Knight Frank or if in the opinion of Knight Frank any personnel is not suitable to provide services, the Vendor will immediately remove the said workman/supervisor/ technicians from the property and replace him with another workman/supervisor/ technician within 3 days at maximum.
  11. The Vendor will not use subcontractors without Knight Frank's prior written approval.
  12. The Vendor shall be required to take and maintain at all times during the subsistence of this Agreement, adequate insurance coverage for the purposes and of the nature of services specified in this P.O.
  13. KNIGHT FRANK reserves the right to terminate this contract anytime without assigning any reason by giving 15 days advance notice in writing to the Vendor. Vendor has to serve two months prior notice showing its intention to terminate this contract.
  14. Upon expiration or termination of this contract for any reason, the Vendor shall provide Knight Frank reasonable termination assistance for up to two (2) months after such termination (the "Transition Period") relating to the transition from the current services necessary for an orderly transfer to a new services provider.
  15. The Vendor shall not be liable for delays or failures in performance resulting from causes beyond its reasonable control, force majeure events including, but not limited to, acts of God, riots, War, power outages and natural disasters.
  16. Unless and until specified in writing, the Vendor and its employees, and representatives shall not approach/communicate directly or indirectly with clients of KNIGHT FRANK during the tenure of this contract. In the event of the same it shall be deemed to be a breach under this contract and the Vendor shall be liable to indemnify Knight Frank and this contract shall stand terminated at the option of Knight Frank.
  17. The Vendor shall ensure that none of its employees/personnel indulge in any eve teasing, ragging and any other harassment, which can take many forms, including sexual, verbal, physical or visual behavior that creates an offensive, hostile, or intimidating environment within and around the workplace. The Vendor and/or its personnel shall at all times comply with The Sexual Harassment Of Women At Workplace(Prevention, Prohibition And Redressal) Act, 2013 and also comply with the sexual harassment policies of Knight Frank and such policies of its customers/clients. Knight Frank may terminate the agreement immediately upon written notice to the Vendor if Knight Frank concludes, in its sole opinion, that the Vendor or any of its personnel/employees has breached any of the provisions of this clause or that the breach is likely to occur.
  18. Before the supply of any materials the Vendor shall obtain Knight Frank consent for the purpose of charging any scheme of VAT/GST.
  19. Any differences or disputes arising out of this contract shall notified by either party to the other party and that the dispute shall be referred to the authorized representative of KNIGHT FRANK and Vendor for resolving the disputes amicably. In case no amicable contract is reached, within 30 days of the notification then the dispute would be referred to arbitration in accordance with and subject to the provisions of the Arbitration & Conciliation Act, 1996, or any statutory modification or re-enactment thereof for the time being in force. The reference shall be made to a sole arbitrator to be appointed by KNIGHT FRANK which decision will be binding and final on the Vendor. The venue of the arbitration shall be at Mumbai and the language of the arbitral proceedings shall be English. Any dispute or Claim arising out of or relating to this Arrangement or the relationship between the Parties created hereby, shall be governed, enforced, and construed under the laws of India.
  20. The Parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Mumbai, which the Parties agree, shall have jurisdiction to the exclusion of all other courts to entertain any action or proceedings in relation to any claim, dispute or difference.
  21. The Vendor shall treat the provisions of this contract as Confidential and shall not disclose any information to third parties without written consent of KNIGHT FRANK.
  22. The Vendor shall not license, sell, publish, disclose, display or otherwise make available the Intellectual Property Products of the Knight Frank. The Vendor shall not use Knight Franks or any of its Client/Customer's name, logo, trademark, service mark or letter heads without the consent of the Knight Frank or consent of such of the Knight Frank's customers or Affiliates in writing.
  23. All notices, communication, requests to be given or made to any of the parties hereto shall be in writing.
  24. The Vendor will not and will not use any third party to give kickbacks, facilitation payments, secret commissions or any other unlawful or improper methods of remuneration to any of the employee or representative of the Knight Frank dealing directly or indirectly with the Vendor.
  25. In the event of a conflict between the terms of the Purchase order and the Vendor agreement the terms of the Vendor agreement shall prevail and that KFIPL shall have the sole right to determine is such terms are conflicting and the decision of KFIPL shall be final and binding on the Vendor.
  26. Any shortfall in deployment will be considered as revenue loss for Knight Frank, and 10% of the shortfall amount of the Customer Invoice will be deducted from the relevant month’s invoice of the Vendor.
  27. The Vendor shall ensure full and proper compliance by it and by all personnel employed or deployed by them of all applicable laws, rules, regulations and other statutory requirements, in carrying out their duties and obligations hereunder. No such personnel shall , for any purposes, be treated or deemed to be employees of KNIGHT FRANK and KNIGHT FRANK shall have no obligations or liabilities whatsoever in relation to any of them.

    28. Remarks : Billing will be on actuals.Invoice should not cross over the PO amount in any circumstances. There should not be any changes in deployment count or costs unless specified and approved by Knight Frank Procurement team in writing supported with a PO. Taxes extra as applicable. Invoice to be submitted on time.

Supplier HSE code of conduct

1 PURPOSE

The purpose of this document is to describe how a SUPPLIER of services specified in the Scope of Work is expected to manage Health, Safety & Environmental (HSE) issues in the execution of Scope of Work for Knight Frank India (Pvt) Ltd. It provides instructions to all supplier of KFI a common HSE standard to ensure that everyone working for the Scope of Work have a reasonable level of understanding of his / her individual and collective responsibilities with respect to HSE practice.

2 SCOPE

The scope of this procedure shall be applicable throughout the contract period including from pre-qualification to evaluation of their HSE performances at CONTRACT close-out. The majority of effort, however, shall focus on selection to ensure that Supplier initially understand the risks associated with the work scope and fully commits to their HSE responsibilities within the KFI managed premises.

3 SUPPLIER HSE REQUIREMENTS
3.1 Compliance to Laws/Regulations/KFI Requirements: -
  1. SUPPLIER shall comply with all applicable Health, Safety, Environmental (HSE) laws and regulations which are applicable to the location where the works are being carried out.
  2. SUPPLIER shall comply at all times with the requirements as set forth by Knight Frank India (PVT) ltd in its Health, Safety, & Environment Management System policies, operating standards, any special instructions, and all requirements stipulated in this document.
3.2 SUPPLIER HSE Policy/Leadership
  1. SUPPLIER shall acknowledge KFI strong commitment to HSE and affirm that it has a written HSE policy which is of a standard comparable to QHSE policy and which has been signed and is actively supported and endorsed by SUPPLIER’s management.
  2. SUPPLIER shall further affirm that its HSE policy is widely disseminated and understood among its employees.
  3. SUPPLIER shall define how SUPPLIER’s Management team members will visibly demonstrate their commitment to HSE by detailing their activities and level of engagement at the work site(s) where the works will be executed. Specific examples may include participation in Joint Management visit, HSE audits, Risk assessment, JSA, SWMS etc)
3.3 Protection of Employees, Public, Assets and Environment
  1. SUPPLIER shall protect the safety and health of workers and people living or working near the SOW execution from potential hazards.
  2. SUPPLIER, without cost to KFI, must take all necessary precautions to protect the public and minimize disturbance and inconvenience to the public resulting from performance of their SOW.
  3. Throughout the performance of the SOW, SUPPLIER shall conduct all operations in such a way as to minimize any impact upon the natural environment including compliance with all laws, regulations and rules applicable to the site.
  4. SUPPLIER shall take all necessary HSE precautions related to or arising out of the performance of the SUBCONTRACT in order to protect the work, the personnel and property of KFI managed premises and its Client, Suppliers, all third parties and public from the hazards associated with the work.
3.3 Right to Stop Work
  1. KFI representative or his designated representatives shall have the right to prohibit commencement of works or to stop any works in progress if the equipment, machinery, tools, personnel or work conditions are considered at KFI to be unsafe or not to be in compliance with any applicable rules, regulations and procedures.
  2. Stoppage of the work shall be until SUPPLIER has satisfactorily rectified such unsafe acts and condition. In the event of serious or repeated violations, KFI may terminate the SUBCONTRACT without any further warnings.
3.4 Competent Personnel
  1. SUPPLIER shall ensure that their personnel assigned to perform the awarded scope of works are fully trained and certified and possess the relevant experiences to carry out the task of operating all machinery, equipment, and tools.
  2. SUPPLIER shall provide an adequate level of technical and HSE related training conducted by a recognized training institution for all relevant personnel in connection with the work.
  3. All SUPPLIER supervisory personnel shall have attended relevant HSE training and be competent in hazard identification and management of hazards at the work site.
  4. SUPPLIER shall ensure that all their personnel engaged in this SOW are healthy and fit to perform the works safely and efficiently.
  5. SUPPLIER shall forward to KFI a copy of their Competency Training matrix listing the personnel they planned to utilise for performing the works. The Competency Matrix shall detail the competency and HSE trainings of the personnel.
  6. SUPPLIER must undergo site specific induction prior to commencement of sow at site.
3.5 Risk Management and Hazard Identification
  1. Subjective to the scope of works to be performed, SUPPLIER may be required to undertakes its own detailed HSE risk assessment for the SOW.
  2. The focus of the assessment should be to evaluate the hazards in conducting their scope of works and the potential adverse consequence of an accident to the workforce, the public and the environment, company assets and reputation.
  3. SUPPLIER is required 7to presents the findings (including Hazard Register) to KFI along with SWMS.
3.6 Equipment, Machinery and PPE
  1. SUPPLIER shall ensure that all machinery, equipment, facilities, and other items in any way associated with or utilized in the SOW are fit for use and maintained in a safe and good working condition at all times.
  2. SUPPLIER shall have an established Planned Maintenance System (PMS) in place.
  3. SUPPLIER personnel assigned to perform their scope of works shall adhere to KFI PPE requirements and other control requirements derived out of the risk assessment.
3.7 Emergency response and incident reporting
  1. SUPPLIER personnel assigned to the project shall adhere to KFI site emergency response arrangements.
  2. SUPPLIER personnel shall actively participate in any emergency drills and exercises organised by KFI to ensure familiarisation with the facility emergency response arrangements.
  3. SUPPLIER shall ensure that any incident while working at KFI owned or controlled facilities must be immediately reported.
  4. SUPPLIER site representatives or Management may be required to participate in any incident investigation arising from such incident depending on the severity of the incident.
3.8 Waste Management

SUPPLIER shall adhere to KFI Waste Management standards for managing and dis-posing of waste(s) generated by their activities while working at KFI owned or controlled facilities.

3.9 General Health, Safety & Environmental requirements.
  1. Smoking is prohibited during the work period and in all controlled buildings and enclosed workplaces.
  2. It is forbidden to possess or consume alcohol, drugs or any intoxicants on site or to be under their influence.
  3. Anyone taking any medication which may cause drowsiness or lack of concentration must inform their supervisor and may not operate hazardous machinery of work alone.
  4. All maintenance and building contractors must report to site facilities management team before starting work where required.
  5. Loose or hanging clothing, jewellery, or long hair is not permitted around moving machines and parts.
  6. Warning signs must be displayed for all work in progress. All contractors should obey the posted warning signs and procedures.
  7. Keep fire exits free from obstruction and fire/smoke doors closed but unblocked.
  8. Keep fire exits free from obstruction and fire/smoke doors closed but unblocked.
  9. No plant or machinery should be operated or used unless authorized to do so.
  10. Immediately correct or report unsafe conditions to the supervisor and/or site facilities management team.
  11. Follow Permit to Work System to control hazardous works and hazardous substances (including hot work, confined space, electrical work, etc).
  12. Follow Permit to Work System to control hazardous works and hazardous substances (including hot work, confined space, electrical work, etc).
  13. 18. No person is allowed entering into the Confined Spaces unless he/she is competent and obtains confined space entry permit.
  14. 19. No hot works including but not limited to welding, cutting, brazing to be conducted, without a Hot Work Permit.
  15. 20. Gas cylinders must be properly secured and vertically stored in a cool, dry place away from any heat sources.
  16. 21. Wear eye protection when involved with any kind of hot work operations or when required.
  17. No live electrical work, otherwise adopting safety measurements (e.g. wearing insulated gloves and placing plastic mattress underneath).
  18. Locking out and tagging out all energy sources without exception
  19. Ladders must be in good condition and properly positioned for access (use of scaffold should be considered first).
  20. 33. Extension ladders must be tied off at the top, or a second person must hold and secure the ladder at the bottom.
  21. Must wear safety belt that is attached to an anchor point when working at height more than 1.8m or when required.
  22. All flammable and/or combustible materials must be removed or at least suitably covered in areas where hot work takes place.
  23. 23. Flammable liquids must be stored in appropriately labelled containers and returned to stores when not in use.
  24. 24. Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) should be maintained for all their hazardous substances that bring on site. Necessary trainings should be provided to contractor’s workers who need to work with those materials/chemicals.
